content:
Posted: May 22, 2015
												When I first saw this game released on Steam, my inner child squeaked of excitement: finally a MMO in which you can play as a teddy bear, how awesome is this!!! Five minutes after I started the game, the enthusiasm was replaced by a huge disappointment because I realized it's a game heavily based on micro transactions despite the fact that it is advertised as free to play on the store page. It is free to play indeed, but only until you reach level 10 (out of 50 currently possible); after that you need a monthly subscription to progress further. I decided to pay for 1 month, because I wanted to explore the whole content and maybe reach the end game.The target audience being mostly children, this game was designed to be very accessible and enjoyable for kids. The story is very simplistic: you need to protect the world from Queen Vexa and her minions called Nix. There is no actual combat; “fighting” is done by running over the minions. The graphics are cute and very colorful and the fact that there is no violence in this game turns the gameplay into a very optimistic and positive experience for a kid. But if you’re an adult, you’re probably going to feel out of place (don’t read: “pedophile”), both because of the simplistic nature of the game and because of the community.Half of the gameplay consists in completing quests for the NPCs, which in turn award you with experience and some silver coins that you can spend in the game shop to buy decorative items for your personal home. Each quest is a mini game of different sorts: either a jigsaw puzzle, or driving a car and collecting items, or some very basic platforming bits and many others. There are some group activities as well, in which you need to collect things or run over the enemies. The quests are very repetitive and become boring very fast. There’s no difference in being level 50 or level 10, except for the fact that some of the items from the shop are locked for lower levels. So in my opinion, there’s no reason or motivation to pay for a subscription and level all way up to 50.The other half of the gameplay consists in gathering numerous collectible items. And here’s the catch: you can obtain around 75% of them from the shop or from the group activities, but for the other 25% you need some special in-game currency (gold coins) that is purchased with real money only. Of course, each of these collections is linked to a Steam achievement, so if you want to go for 100% achievements, be prepared to throw big money at them. This was one of the things that set me back a lot, since I consider that a game that offers special items for real money should at least be free of charge (no subscription needed). Or if a subscription is required, then this special currency should also be obtainable through other means in game, without having to pay for it (unless you really want to do so). Even more so, I consider that the achievements for these collections, which can be completed only by spending $10-$20 on each, should be completely banned from Steam. Until recently there was no way to obtain these gold coins by only playing the game without a subscription; however, since they increased some of the prices a lot and added many new special items, they decided to add to the group events some occasional rewards consisting in very small amounts of this currency. For every group event you are now eligible to obtain 20-50 gold coins, which means that you need to participate in hundreds of these events, bordering to 1000 for a couple of achievements, and all this assuming that you get something every time you play. This is practically a sad and lame joke from Ganz’ part.Bottom line: I don’t recommend this game since its sole purpose is to drain your wallet. And don’t show it to your little kids either, since they’ll probably start begging you to buy them silly things that cost a lot of money.More reviews on the Lilly's Corner Curator page

My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

Posted: August 7, 2014
												Definitely a good children's introductory MMO game. Kids would be introduced to the world of quest grinding which involves loooots of running around and occasionally play simple platform-type and other various minigames. There are a number of co-op/team play features and it involves..... more running around (yay). I'm not kidding. You will be spending 80% of the time running around to level up. Because violence is a no no ;D. The remaining 20% of the time would be either playing those minigames or customising your garden and home.I'm not recommending it because firstly, you need to pay a monthly fee to get past level 10. I suppose the first 10 levels could serve as a demo for this "free to play" MMO. But I'm sure there are other better and more "educational" games out there than this one. Or you could just get your children to play in real life~

number of helpful: 83 of 98 people (85%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 14, 2015
												Just a heads up. This game has a premium currency called e-Store points in trade for your real cash. Available in separate packages shown here: http://www.ganzestore.com/estore/catalog/points , or with a membership purchase you can gain set amounts per month. In 2015 Ganz also added the option to win small random amounts from Team Play (mini games) which will no doubt take a lot of real time but requires no extra cash. Moving on. If you are downloading this for your child it is a cute starter MMO and they will likely enjoy the bright cheerful characters and colorful world with no questions asked. If you are a teen+ who enjoys cute games its a fun way to kill some time with casual games and quests but you might find it all becomes repetitive. And without paying for a membership it can feel pointless as you can't increase your level passed 10 out of 50 levels.Achievement Hunters Be Warned: It feels like this game could be attached to your Steam Wallet as Ganz has started pushing the in-game collections (which double as steam achievements) to require premium currency. Or just invest a lot of time with the option to win at team play to gradually chip away at the collections that require premium currency to purchase. - April 2016 update - At this time Ganz might have seen the light. The last collection to double as an achievement that I noticed was October of 2015 as my Comments below show. Just hope to see this continue so the buying/spending premium currency feels more optional as it should. I mostly wrote this review because even if it fell on deaf ears I felt gamers need to start speaking up against sucking our purses dry. Also not wanting to see this trend in Amazing World continue with more future collections requiring premium currency. Which I will note in the Comments of this review.Despite the negative reviews saying it was not free to play as advertised it was cute so I gave it a try. I had a positive review up until the Sushi update in May, 2015 which began a trend of releasing collections requiring e-Store (micro transaction) purchases to complete. Previously items were won in Team Play games, Karma's Wheel, and purchased with common coin purchases. A rare few were also Moneyz which were earned from opening pages on their website[www.ganzworld.com].At some point in 2015 I feel greed hit with new staff and I should have realized something was up when extra spins on Karma's Wheel increased from 100 to 500 premium currency. Unfortunately I didn't until the new collection (and also achievement) "All You Can Eat" came up and requires 10,000 premium eStore Points to buy 3 sushi items in the World Shop. It has no place being a steam achievement without a second option in my opinion. I guess the option is the introduction of earning a very small amounts if you manage to win at Team Play. But just to put things in perspective. I won 45 eStore Points playing Groggy team play. So give or take if you were lucky enough to win every time and get that amount. I would have to play and win 223 times to finish that one new achievement. - But my next win was only 25...which would make it 400 wins to get the needed amount. - My third win I got zero eStore Points. On the positive side. Their Customer Service when using the Ganz web form has been outstanding. When I first found AW I paid for a year membership and that gives 5,000 eStore monthly. However, I had a glitch that it didn't automatically happen so I would have to contact them to get it, and the reply always pretty fast. - On Oct 15, 2015 CS said this was resolved.

content:
Posted: August 10, 2014
												I don't even think this deserves to be on Steam.First, it's not even F2P. It's a bit like Club Penguin, in CP you pay to get upgrades and items to wear and different coloured pets and stuff like that. Personally don't see too much of a problem as long as children aren't stealing credit cards to pay, but in CP, you can play for however long as you like for free with the only limitations being you can't wear certain items/obtain them. Plus both Amazing World and Club Penguin are aimed at children. After Level 10 of Amazing World, you can't earn xp or do much because most of the quests require Level 13 or above. You CANNOT level up without PAYING A SUBSCRIPTION TO BE A MEMBER. That is NOT F2P.The missions are just the same things over and over, run to speak to this person, pick up things in that corner of the game, a small platformer type of game then TP back to the quest-giver. It's just that over and over, there's no creativity in the missions.The description does not mention that it is capped at level 10. It's a misleading pile of bull. It shouldn't be on Steam and deserves to stay on it's own website. I would not recommend parents get this for their children, I wouldn't recommend a child getting it for their parents, I wouldn't recommend it to ANYONE... or $30 for 12 months access to level up, wear clothing and do quests if you really want to repeat gameplay and missions.

Posted: April 11, 2016
												It's like Webkinz and Club Penguin, but it's much deeper. It offers a rich and original story, and innovative gameplay.When you first launch it, it may seem intimidating, but as you delve deeper, it becomes a lot easier to understand. This game does not hold your hand the whole time in that it offers no tutorial, so the learning curve is a bit high for someone who doesn't play many action games such as this, but it's worth it once you learn how to play. The controls are fairly simple, too.It also offers a fully fleshed out combat system. It'll be amazing when the game eventually gets VR capabilities.All in all, it's a fun game, hundreds of hours of enjoyable gameplay. It's definitely worth it to pay the monthly fee of $3.99 to get the full experience of the game.

content:
Posted: October 10, 2014
												The game advertises itself as a f2p game, and sure, initially, once you start the game everything is fine. There are certainly some items that cost real money to unlock but that's understandable for a game that needs to sustain itself.Then you find out that private chat requires a membership. Okay, that's not TOO bad cause you can just talk in public with your friends right?Then, you realise some skills are locked, so you cannot do all the quests that paid members can. Still, that's entirely understandable. So, you miss out on certain content but you get to enjoy a majority of it right?Wrong. Once you get to level 10, you are effectively done with the game as a free player. You will not be able to gain any more exp unless you SUBSCRIBE as a member. It's not even a "pay to unlock more levels". It's "keep paying monthly to get more levels". You might think that you can just do quests and ignore the levels but as most items require you to be level 11 or higher, you're stuck with the few items that are below level 10.This game had so much promise, and the game actually could attract a very wide audience (even adult youtubers have started to play the game), yet the way the game has been monetized has ruined any chances of it of being popular with anyone other than kids with rich parents.Don't bother with the game unless you're going to subscribe. It's a waste of time otherwise.

Humans are the primary cause of this through hunting and the destruction of habitats.Around half of tiger cubs don’t live beyond two years of age.Tiger cubs leave their mother when they are around 2 years of age.A group of tigers is known as an ‘ambush’ or ‘streak’.Tigers are good swimmers and can swim up to 6 kilometres.Rare white tigers carry a gene that is only present in around 1 in every 10000 tigers.Tigers usually hunt alone at night time.Tigers have been known to reach speeds up to 65 kph (40 mph).Less than 10% of hunts end successfully for tigersTigers can easily jump over 5 metres in length.Various tiger subspecies are the national animals of Bangladesh, India, North Korea, South Korea and Malaysia.There are more tigers held privately as pets than there are in the wild.Tigers that breed with lions give birth to hybrids known as tigons and ligers.

												Oh my goodness, what a game! The story is top notch, and I was biting my nails the whole time. I could really feel the characters' struggles. Be warned, this game will be very intensive on your pc, this is some next-gen level stuff! As an aging man, my wife told me that she would divorce me if I didn't stop playing this game, but let me tell you something: she is gone. That is all I will say about my wife. She isn't in the way anymore. Amazing World is infinitely better than the woman who once loved me. I can't wait to get back to my adventures in Amazing World, the scale, the depth, the everything, I don't want to live in a world without Amazing World, because Amazing World, is MY world.

content:
Posted: May 16, 2015
												I really have mixed feelings about this one. Its created by Ganez the company who produced Tail Town Friends on Facebook and deleted it because it wasn't making enough money...The game promises to be an open safe haven game for children to play. It's definitely designed for children as the level of difficulty is simply to walk into most things. The abundant amount of colors in this world is like someone threw a grenade in a paint factory. Everything is awesome. Everyone loves everyone. All characters are so cute you want to take them home. You start to notice simple things like that the birds are singing, the hills are green, the flowers are vibrant and that your in love with all these gerbils. Just when all things are peachy. The dark clouds of 'WE WANT MONEY' start rolling in at level 10. Seriously you have to cough up $30.00 a year at least if you want to continue past that point to play the main game play.I'm not sure how many of the side quests you can still do without the coughing up of real money, but the announcement sure does serve as an eyesore, like as if someone just grabbed your head and held it over a steaming hot plate and said 'pay up!'.The story is that you have to save the world from Queen Nix who rules a bunch of cute grey colored critters that brandish sledgehammers and start smacking away at the world causing zero damage. They are easily defeated by simply walking into them. Some how doing household chores like gardening will eventually train your super powers of walking into things and eventually save the world...???The side scrolling platform games look great and really had me interested because of it's unique look. The 3D open world is also huge and interesting to explore, the game does give you your own decoration grid and a massive catalog of decor items. However there is not enough in the game for me to warrant $30.00 a year.Is it really a safe haven? I found it to be very easy to add people in there and start chatting away and since it is designed for children, you would expect predators in there would you not? It does seem to be monitored though. One person reported that he got banned simply because he jokingly typed 'come touch my meat'. All jokes aside i think the adults sometimes forget there are children here, so the banning side of things is welcoming.Simply put, there isn't enough of the game and it's not involving enough to inspire me to make any long term investment and there is no once off payment to make either. One would question how popular this really is as a baby sitter since we have so many cute games to entertain children thanks to Nintendo. While this might not be PC, there are such things as emulators to incorporate those games to PC.One more thing I forgot, many found that at certain points the loading of the various worlds would crash and send you back to Steam. The only way I found around this was to play the browser game direct and get past the load point and then return back to Steam so Steam Cloud could catch up to where you exactly are in the game.My suggestion is, if your really looking for a game to entertain your children. Try board games, they don't require $30.00 a year...

In that short span of time my life spiraled out of contol, people I bumped into on the street turned into pixie dust and dissapeared. They screamed. God, help me, I still hear the screams. Just. ♥♥♥♥ing Waiting.I feel the cold metallic taste of the barrel in my mouth, and I feel the gazes and I hear the screams and I see them, laughing, taunting as I cry for them, pixie dust rising from mine and their skin.I pull the trigger. Pitch black. Every memory I ever ad of them is now splattered on this cheap Motel wall.I'm safe. So finally safe. 												First thing i have to say is it is a great first mmo for kids but when it comes down to it you can only be level 10 with out paying for a member ship. This is not to say you cant do anything after this point you can repeat pretty much the same quests over and over again and your kid probley wont know the difference. i played this game for about 2 hours before i got bored of it. you basicly go around walking over things to complete quests and you can unlock items for your house or special hats and if you get high enough level in a skill you can buy maybe 1-3 special items from that skill shop like a full on space suit. ill recommend it because little kids wont notice these things and just walk around like wooo i am playing a game as a cow or something. i am still waiting on the pvp expansion where i can use my koala space drone to 1v1 some other animals. if they get rid of the level cap on membership and give you full access to the game it would be fun and i would recommend it more. 6/10points lost for level cap and repeatitive quests and music. bonus points for multiplayer world quests and some decent gameplay.

One of the cheapest MMOs out there that I've seen), but at the same time you can buy extra in-game special currency that can be quite pricy (priced anywhere between 9.99$ to 99$).Do you need items from the in-game shop to enjoy the game? No. But first make sure that your child won't throw a tantrum over it. :)

												If you are bored of the games in your library, you have no money to buy more steam points, then get amazing world. I discovered this cute game at a friends sleep over one time. I looked at it and said this is ridiculous, then looked to my friend and said... we got to try it. So we did and after that it gave me a couple hours of fun. But that's all. Think of amazing world as webkinz and runescape had a baby. You have certain skills such as cooking and gardening, woodcrafting, and then the odd ones, icecream, singing and so forth. It is HEAVELY based on pay to win. So unless this game you are going to invest in with your young child. It is only for a couple hours of laughs.

content:
Posted: August 20, 2014
												One of the best MMO experiences I've ever had the pleasure of partaking in.I would rather play this game than make sweet, passionate love with a supermodel on top of a shark riding a dinosaur holding a lightsaber fighting Godzilla  on the Empire State Building. I would rather play this game than furiously masturbate, though I often do both at the same time, since this game only really requires one hand.The colours will make any man want to choke his chicken and instantly made me go through a second puberty; it was like a heavenly light shone on me and started fist♥♥♥♥ing me, chanting tribal songs as they made a sacrifice to Allah. Delightful.The game appeals to my love of beating animals with my fists while butt♥♥♥♥♥naked. Being able to do so while beating myself is just pure bliss. The PvP is so intense that it makes me as sweaty as a grandma that slept in a sleeping bag, covered in latex in a purely isolated room with five heaters inside with no windows or doors in the middle of August. That's how intense it is.That being said, the game can also make you rage due to the player not being so good at the game. I sometimes cannot quickscope fast enough, as I am not an xX3lite_420blzit_360noscope_proXx. This makes me rage with the fury of a thousand suns and the hellish maelstrom of pure mental assrape.All in all, though, I feel that the game is terrific, though it needs to be balanced. Being the Cow is OP, as it is much easier to quickscope somebody from across the map with much better killstreaks than the other classes. But seriously, I ♥♥♥♥ing love this game, it made me into the man I am today, no longer a shriveling ♥♥♥♥♥, too afraid to play such spooky and intense games.Oh, and I couldn't get past the tutorial....I came.11/10

content:
Posted: August 7, 2014
												This game is mainly for kids but its fun for all ages. The games are educational some are just for fun but all are very enjoyable. The quests help the player gain items for your home base or Items you could wear. How you decorate or dress up is all up to the creative mind of the player. You could invite your friends to come play at your home. There is fishing (I believe the developers did a wonderful job capturing the excitement of actually catching something) loads of in game events happening all the time. Completion of these events award you based on how you did. Those that participated will always walk away with something. I even found a mini dungeon or raid (if you will) where you team up with other players to accomplish a goal very fun!! This game is guaranteed to put smiles on anyone face all the characters are so adorable. If you’re looking for a game for a young one starting to learn their way around a computer even an experienced player I would recommend this game. I would also recommend this game for anyone who is having a bad day like I said before it’s guaranteed to make you smile and if does not, you need to look for your inner child. Come on down and give it a try there is something for everyone.

content:
Posted: August 8, 2014
												I can extremely NOT recommend this game. First off it is NOT free-to-play, it is a TRIAL game you get to play with heavy limitations (eg max level 10), and full "Members" access is SUBSCRIPTION based which it clearly does not display at all on the store page. There are also big billboards ingame advertising and trying to lure users to be full members, etc.I will very much make sure to warn all my friends and their familes to avoid this game at all costs. It is a real shame as if it wasn't for those problems this would have been a real nice fun game for younger players. Hopefully the developers will change these "features" and if so then I will totally recommend this game. But for now, as-is, I can not at all recommend and would infact strongly suggest avoiding this entirely at all costs unless you don't mind subscription based games.

content:
Posted: July 13, 2016
												Coming from a 19 year old who has now played over 42 hours on this game, spent about $14.00 and can't STOP playing the game, this is an honest reivew to the best of my ability.Pros of Amazing World. -Tons of content to keep you busy. -Buildable relationships with characters. (Thngs you do actually improve things for them)-Big overworld that changes with the seasons.-Not having to pay for gold coins. (But paying for more does get them quicker)-Building up silver coins is easy.-TONS of customization, (Characters,clothes,homes,craftable items,yard items, dimensions)-Still getting updates even 2 years later.-Team attack games.-Well done boss fights.-Great customer service that actually responds.-Can reach max level in under a month. -Did I mention you can own your own dimensions??Cons of Amazing World.-Quests can get repetitive-There is a fee to keep playing after level 10. (But honestly if you can't afford $3.99 get off Steam and mow a lawn.)-Can't own two different accounts with member on one Steam account.-Controls could be better and are a bit hard to get used to.(Add controller support please)-Some craftables are not permanent, even though the items to craft them are hard to get.If I think of more Cons or Pros I'll add them, but as of right now that's it. You're probably wondering why "GLITCHES" is not listed in Cons, that's because the game is still being updates and we are bound to see those glitches go away with time, so putting that agaisnt them really isn't fair considering every game is going to have glitches.

content:
Posted: August 19, 2014
												A good pc for young children, we don't get many children's games on Steam or pc in general. I myself played Amazing World a little bit, and I can have to say, it doesn't get anymore children's based than this. I want to be clear though this is for "young" children so The Ideal age range in my opinion is 3-6 years old, after all we know kids 7+ would all rather play the latest Call of Duty or something. I honestly doubt there are many children playing, I would guess that most of the players could indeed be older than the intended age range, especially since the game has come to Steam. Even with this fact I still think Amazing World is a decent children's game, and a good try for a children's mmo. The game is free (mostly) but you will find a lot of features locked, only available to  subscription, or paying accounts, You can give Amazing World a try yourself, if you are wary about letting your child play an online game as it is free to download and play right here on Steam.

content:
Posted: August 8, 2014
												This game is extremely well polished, as it should be since its for children. When you sign-up it doesn't ask for your email, it asks for your parents email. Everything, including the bad guys are super cutesy. Overall the game seems great for kids, graphics are cute, game play seems simple and easy to get used to. One big problem I noticed when I got into a public space is a lot of people are spamming "..." which must be swearing and people saying stuff like "Santa isn't real", but i'm sure this will smooth out a bit after this game has been out a while. Okay another big issue is the pay wall. You can get a few levels but then you get stuck until you sign up for a membership. The prices for that aren't bad but the game is just stopped if you don't start paying. Overall it's worth letting your kids try it, or try it yourself and take some cute screenshots. 7/10

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 17, 2014
												This game (or should I say piece of art) has it all baby, it’s got the graphics, it’s got the story, it’s got the gameplay, it’s the soundtrack, this game is the true definition of a gaming masterpiece. You start out immediately with the ability to customize your customize your character in way that rivals the likes of Skyrim or even the Sims. You are then introduced to your companions on a ship above spring bay where everything is going to♥♥♥♥♥♥ Crime is at an all-time high and you’re the only who fix this crime ridden town. I can't say to much more about the game because I don't want to spoil the plot for all of you but it gets intense and the love story is beyond average. Imagine if 50 shades of gray if it was actually good and all characters were replaced by teddies that are both lovable and incredibly attractive. Another amazing thing about Amazing World (you see what I did there?), is its ability to be an both an mmo RPG and combine elements from such excellent titles such as Drake and the 99 Dragons, and Superman 64. This also manages to be an mmo where it's actually fun to farm and rank up. The loot system is also a great improvment compared to recent titles like Borderlands. My only complaint about this game is getting TO immeresed in the world and storyline, which is easy beacause  of how believable the charcters are and how well written the plot is. Overall I would say that if you havn't expierinced this game yet, I would highly recommend you do because it is a damn good game. I Give it A solid 10/10

content:
Posted: January 28, 2016
												After playing a couple hours with my four year-old I purchased a year's membership -- and it's the best money I've spent on Steam so far.  My daughter LOVES this game: she continues to quest with Gelato and Cannoli after maxing out both characters.  (She's an adorable master of hot and cold treats!)  And then there are the hours of entertainment we've had watching her zing hop up and down on Howl's whoopie cushion trampoline, then go inside and sit on the ice cream chair  because after all that pooting she needs to go on the potty.  She's also working on hand-eye coordination, mastering 16-piece jigsaw puzzles, rearranging her yard, dressing and undressing her zings, going on quests and otherwise engaging with the brightly colored, gentle environment.  We haven't started using the "Friends" and "chat" features yet -- she just turned 4 and I think we can wait a bit on that one.  But we've certainly taken advantage of much of what this game has to offer, and would recommend it without hesitation to curious youngsters and the caregivers who love them.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 7, 2014
												Cons: Parental control access is difficult to find if they access at all. This is not ideal seeing as this is a game that is clearly targeted to children.Not rated by the ESRB. Although it is not a requirement for games to be rated it is very helpful and useful so that an adult does not need to first sit down and play through the game to know what content is in the game. Not all that important but it is very helpful and convient to have the rating with some type of information to quickly decide if appropriate for a child or if the adult should sit down and play it first. Free to play is very limited. Free to play lasts only until level 10. Which took about 1 hour 10 minutes for me to get to but it could be longer for a child.Terms of service was not in the client window and is not required to be clicked to continue registration.Pros: When creating a characther name it does have a very good filter one that is a bit on the strong side the filter would not allow the name it randomly generated due to the word Shell.This game is adorably cute. So it is  good for children with mininamal violence. At most atleast until level 10 you just run into the the little Nix.It does have 2 types of access one via the steam client and one via the adventure world website itself. The website version is browser based and requires the Unity plugin.For an MMORPG membership is fairly cheap. A 12 month membership is 30.00 USD as of August 7th 2014.If you do click on the terms of services they do give you a link to COPPA which explains what it is and provides other useful information on it.Ultimately for a young child's game it is a decent to very good game. The limited free to play of the game allows you to let your child test it before you purchase anything in the game with real world cash. I would recommend this product only if you are looking for a game to introduce a child to the world of MMORPGs

Posted: August 19, 2015
												This game is Truely Amazing...The plot is truely a master piece...You are a Zing a "cute" animal hero where you must choose to be a Cow, a Fox, a blue dog, a green mutant dog hamster thing, a pink elephant, and a bear! In this amazing adventure you find yourself on a airship with this pink thing called Bloom who shows you the ropes of movement! Until! you are attacked by the evil Nix! DUN DUN DUUUUNNNN. Your must quickly prepare for combat as the evil Nix (purple mutant bunnies things) invade your ship. You must fight them using highly advanced combat of walking and waving your arms in the air to make this evil cruel monsters vanish. You take no damage nor have health! The evil Nix don't fight back they sit they and slap the ship! BUT THEN OUT A STORM APPEARS! OH NO THE EVIL VEXA ANOTHER PINK THING APPEARS RIDING A GREEN FART CLOUD! She pllans to destroy and rule over the city of Spring Bay! You must now escape with Bloom on the gliders that magically are set on the side of the ship to escape! Upon escaping you find yourself in the AMAZING WORLD!  IN THIS AMAZING WORLD, WHERE YOU MUST DO HARD QUESTS! OF PICKING UP FLOWERS!, PLANTING SEEDS, WAVING YOUR HANDS IN THE AIR TO DEFEAT THE NIX, WALKING 5 FEET, DRIVING A CAR THAT MOVES AT THE SPEED OF 2 MPH TO SAVE THE WORLD! WILL YOU BE A TRUE HERO? PLAY FOR FREE, TEAM UP WITH FRIENDS, AND HAVE AN AMAZING ADVENTURE UNTIL YOU HIT LEVEL 10 WHERE YOU MUST PAY FOR MEMBERSHIP TO GET EXCLUSIVE ITEMS SUCH AS MORE CLOTHING, MORE ZINGS, AND FLOWERS FOR YOUR USELESS HOUSE! OR DO WHAT I DID... AND GET MUTED AFTER 5 MINUTES FOR DOING THE UNTHINKABLE....SPEAKING YOUR MIND...FREEDOM OF SPEECH BY TELLING THAT PINK ELEPHANT "YO DUMB♥♥♥♥♥PUT SOME CLOTHES ON BEFORE I BEAT YO PINK♥♥♥♥♥quot; .10/10 THIS GAME IS AMAZING

Posted: July 17, 2015
												I absolutly would not reccommend this game. I saw it for free on the steam list and decided hey, might as well check it out, it could be a fun learning experience. But I was so wrong. Immediatly my character is attacked while on the magical flying pirate ship by some kind of furrie terrorists. And the ship crashed. It triggered me because I do not like 9/11 because I am a proud american.  My character did a life endangering stunt by jumping off the ship with a hang glider, wish was obviously designed for 1 person with 2 people! Kids could learn to jump off their roofs from that which in my books is not ok not one bit at all, nope. THIS IS NOT EVEN THE WORST PART YET!!!! I have already invested time creating a character, registering my username and surviving this sexist cutscene degrading women by having the female main character appear weak which really offended me. So I am finally at the town and I see another player. I decide this is my chance to make friends and possibly learn the ropes like how to customize my new home. I say , "hello my name is tyrone" in the chat it comes up at "..." I did not understand because the game did not tell me why. I typed it several more times then the game informed me I was saying something offensive. Then I figured it out. THIS GAME IS RACIST. The game would not let me say the name tyrone because the developers are all cis scum who are against feminism and probably are all white suppremist hitler worshipers. I became so triggered I almost had a panic attack. I took several deep breaths just like I learned on Tumblr then decided to inform anyone thinking of playing this not to. DO NOT PLAY THIS GAME!                                                    overall 3/10 would not recommend :/

Posted: August 6, 2014
												This game is fantastic! So far i am having a great time. This game is great for kids and is appropriate for all ages. With being able to level up, do quests, get achievments, and meet some new people this game will keep you entertained for quite along time. If your lucky you can also meet a staff member from the game inside the game and you can follow him and he drops money! You can also fish. Another great feature is that you can build a house and fix it how you want. Then you can invite your friends to your house to hang out with you.

Posted: August 9, 2014
												This is the most rage inducing RPG I have ever played in the first 10 minutes I could not decide between the 3 different pants and shirts so I just said screw it and went naked, I then snapped my keyboard in half because I was unable to name my zing, then I clicked the random name button until I recieved a name worth keeping.... In the next 10 minutes I found an old keyboard and defeated the Nix that were attacking the ship by "scaring" them... By that time I was so bored I thought about death.. I attempted to take my own zing's life my jumping off the edge of the ship but there was an invisible barrier preventing me from doing so.. when I finally got to a point where I was able to mingle with random people I found it insulting that all of these 1st graders were telling me that I needed to put some clothes on, One of them even went to the extent of getting his/her parents on the keyboard -_- they proceded to tell me that I was setting a bad example for their child and that I needed to get a life. I recomend this game to anyone that enjoys raging at video games and enjoys arguing with little kids over chat! 10/10yoloswagmuffins

content:
Posted: October 18, 2014
												When I saw all the lovely reviews for this AAA MMORPG, I decided I would give it a try. Oh boy, where do I start? The character customization is out of this world, it has a variety of costumes available for your character. My character was a nudist bear who was inspired by the famous leader, Mao Zedong. The graphics out-class all other games I have played, my PC even froze for 28 hours whilst it was trying to render all the shaders. The voice acting and lip syncing is great, with a wide variety of characters including an autistic Koala.PROSNext Gen Graphics.Gameplay elite to all other MMOs.Even my Nan can play it.CONSGave me severe autism.Addicting.Graphics are too good.

content:
Posted: November 30, 2014
												Before you start The Amazing World you pick a character, you can choose between a Cow, Bear or Bunny.You dress it up and your ready to go.You get your own house with a garden that you can decorate. You can buy items in the shop with money you earn by doing missions. Sadly you unlock items to buy by leveling but you can only level up till lvl 10 after that you have to pay.The Amazing World is super cute. There are alot of missions you can do and get alot of items for free!But after a hour you get bored fast because its the same sort of missions everytime.Jumping games, Memory games, sorting items games,catching items games and go to this person and this person.I dont think its much fun for the adults but this game is perfect for kids specially the little ones around age 6.Its one of the most childfriendly games ive ever seen.There is no harm in anything! It looks cute, happy music and alot to do.Its sad that you have to pay after level 10 or else i would have played it more often myself too lol.

content:
Posted: August 17, 2014
												When you compare this game to other child games on consoles (mostly on the old Wii but also on the old DS), these games are badly made and mostly unplayable. Amazing World offers you a huge map to discover with different tasks to accomplish and items to unlock, it's amazingly fun to play. I'm 23 years old and I am not ashamed to say that I actually enjoyed this game, like most of you though since you're all frustrated you need to pay to play after level 10.Anyway, the game is new, so with some imperfections.First of all, the quests between the different NPCs are the same, only the design changes and it can be a hard work after a time. Educational tasks can be nice for kids to learn while having fun.Also, kids need more support, unless they play the game with a parent, they won't know what to do because in the end, you just have to talk to random NPCs to start a task. A Random event of an NPC, like events for the Teamplays, can be useful for them to play by themselves I think. This way, it would be easier for them to unlock the Icebox Blast or the Talia's Tower for example.Secondly, many glitches can be found, in the main map and in the Home Zone. In your home you can duplicate your items if you use them a wrong way.Despite that, the devs have made an excellent work to build this game up. Also, if you have any problem with the game, they have an incredible helpful support that will help you the best they can. Something I've never seen in any other game yet.This game is the start of great ideas for kids to enjoy MMOs, with friends or alone. These kind of games are known to be addictive, this one is nearly it. I hope this game will have improvements and adds to make it even more fun.

Posted: September 26, 2014
												I give this game an orca/5, it's got good gramphics, and it's got good grameplay. The game really has a great storyline, and I must say the the gecko gambling station probably was one of the best parts of the game. It is a very terrifying game however, as the main enemies are little blue and purple aliens. They also incorporated the elements of games like Spooper Wario bruhs, and with the difficulty curve that reminds me of Dark souls. The games MMO incorporation made it really come alive however, the people running around in realtime, and making the game much more hectic. However the Chef hat looks like a white and rainbow spotted scrotum, so I can't give this game a donkey/6, but only an orca outa/5. Overall, cancer is bad and we should cure it with this game. #merica

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 17, 2014
												When you compare this game to other child games on consoles (mostly on the old Wii but also on the old DS), these games are badly made and mostly unplayable. Amazing World offers you a huge map to discover with different tasks to accomplish and items to unlock, it's amazingly fun to play. I'm 23 years old and I am not ashamed to say that I actually enjoyed this game, like most of you though since you're all frustrated you need to pay to play after level 10.Anyway, the game is new, so with some imperfections.First of all, the quests between the different NPCs are the same, only the design changes and it can be a hard work after a time. Educational tasks can be nice for kids to learn while having fun.Also, kids need more support, unless they play the game with a parent, they won't know what to do because in the end, you just have to talk to random NPCs to start a task. A Random event of an NPC, like events for the Teamplays, can be useful for them to play by themselves I think. This way, it would be easier for them to unlock the Icebox Blast or the Talia's Tower for example.Secondly, many glitches can be found, in the main map and in the Home Zone. In your home you can duplicate your items if you use them a wrong way.Despite that, the devs have made an excellent work to build this game up. Also, if you have any problem with the game, they have an incredible helpful support that will help you the best they can. Something I've never seen in any other game yet.This game is the start of great ideas for kids to enjoy MMOs, with friends or alone. These kind of games are known to be addictive, this one is nearly it. I hope this game will have improvements and adds to make it even more fun.

												I give this game an orca/5, it's got good gramphics, and it's got good grameplay. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 10, 2016
												I tried to put myself in the mindset of the target audience when I was playing this game, but even when I did, I found that there were a few disruptive problems that make this quite inaccessible.The main problem, as pointed out by most of the reviews that don't recommend this game, is that you need to pay for membership to get past level 10, something that is often popped up in your face while you play once you hit that level. This wouldn't be a problem if a lot of the content was blocked to those below certain levels, making this a game that can only really be enjoyed in the long-term if you pay for a membership.The second problem that I found fairly intrusive is the janky jump and collision physics. There's a minigame where you have to collect fruit and avoid some demonic, spiky balls. If you touch these, you are sent back until you hit the next solid object; this means that if you jump while touching this, you are sent rocketing into the sky for a few seconds before hurtling back to the ground. This could be potentially very disorientating for a child playing.The third problem is one can't aim to collect certain matierals for crafting, since they are all given as random drops when completing missions. This means one can't really aim to make a certain thing to create for their home, which then makes the crafting system quite pointless.Overall, this is a nice game in terms of aesthetics, but I couldn't recommend it for children as an introduction to gaming or MMOs, or even just for anything in general. I didn't pay, so I don't know all the features, but it seems a little broken as it stands.

Posted: September 10, 2016
												I tried to put myself in the mindset of the target audience when I was playing this game, but even when I did, I found that there were a few disruptive problems that make this quite inaccessible.The main problem, as pointed out by most of the reviews that don't recommend this game, is that you need to pay for membership to get past level 10, something that is often popped up in your face while you play once you hit that level. This wouldn't be a problem if a lot of the content was blocked to those below certain levels, making this a game that can only really be enjoyed in the long-term if you pay for a membership.The second problem that I found fairly intrusive is the janky jump and collision physics. There's a minigame where you have to collect fruit and avoid some demonic, spiky balls. If you touch these, you are sent back until you hit the next solid object; this means that if you jump while touching this, you are sent rocketing into the sky for a few seconds before hurtling back to the ground. This could be potentially very disorientating for a child playing.The third problem is one can't aim to collect certain matierals for crafting, since they are all given as random drops when completing missions. This means one can't really aim to make a certain thing to create for their home, which then makes the crafting system quite pointless.Overall, this is a nice game in terms of aesthetics, but I couldn't recommend it for children as an introduction to gaming or MMOs, or even just for anything in general. I didn't pay, so I don't know all the features, but it seems a little broken as it stands.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 7, 2014
												Amazing World is a must-own for nearly any Steam user, and especially for any PC gaming enthusiast. As soon as you start the game, you are greeted with a defining and well organized character creation screen. The selections to choose from and the options to personalize are endless, and customization has never been this user-friendly before in any MMORPG game. The in-game dialogue is similar to that of an award winning novel. An extensive range of vocabulary, with fabulous voice acting makes it seem like I'm listening to a conversation in real life. The game takes it a step even furthur by adding an in-game chat feature. With a parent or guardian's email address, you will have access to communicate with any other player in the game. Making new online friends has never been a fun and easy experience until Amazing World came along. You will be treated with crystal clear eye-candy visuals when playing this game. Never in my life have I witnessed anything on my computer screen this realistic. Your jaw will drop when you come face to face with this beautiful sight of video game graphics. Gameplay is well thought out and challenging, yet it remains to be extremely fun for the player and has a completely original aspect. However, this game is for babies and for that I will not recommend it.

content:
Posted: August 10, 2014
												This game is the game that heals all of your ills. As a matter of fact, the famous book "Chicken Soup for the Soul" was a metaphor for this game. Most people downrate this game for forcing you to pay after level 10. But, what they dont realize is that with this game, you don't need a college education, or food, or a social life. No, gentlemen, let your beards grow long as you whittle away your hours being amazing, oddly-colored animals wearing no clothes.On the downside, there was a lack of quickscoping ability in this game, so I was unable to get a "triple". But, you can still be pretty 1337 if you so desire.Everyone, prepare your butts, because it's about to be slam time when you enter this new money sucking creation from the makers of Webkinz, the reason your parents couldn't afford food when you were younger. But, that's alright, because your soul will be filled with childish joy that you only experience when you are a young boy after successfully entering a random activation code for a Webkinz doll, knowing that you just ruined someone else's day.To summarize, this game will blow you away. This game will change you as a person. This game has more change than the Obama administration.3hunna/10 GOTY 2014

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 18, 2014
												Amazing World takes place 280 years in the future of Bioshock Infinity, enough time for cute living, breathing, stuffed animals named "Zings" to inhabit a whole world and set up a bunch of wacky errands and tasks for other Zings to carry out all on their own, while the threat of "antagonist witch lady" and her minions called "The Nix" messing with your mini games a little hangs over your world at every moment.Now, enough about story lets get to the actual grameplay.Most of the grempley is, like I said, completing a bunch of oddjobs for a bunch of other NPC Zings. These Zings include: Cannoli (AW's very own Walter White whose theme song is my JAM), Some Pink Bear Named Bloom, Space Koala, The Tf2 Sniper, and a whole bunch more. Did I happen to mention the gambling station!? Phenominal. Lizard Guy has you spin a weel and you bet your whole fricking Webkins account just to get a pink fricking shirt. Although, you DO get a hella FPS expansion pack when you type in the secret code from your Doritos and Mt. Dew you've been consuming to play this game night after night. They also managed to fit in a few Wario Kart, WOW, and Little Big Planet themed levels in there to represent the deeper meaning of modern day society. Which I found was very powerful and moving.Grampics are pretty cool for a cartoonish game but I really wish there was more horses like in the original Miami Hotline dlc pack. Also there wasnt as much yiffing going on here as was expected??? someone maybe help???anyway prettty stellar indie graphics, dude. B)OVERALL:Story: Better than Dr DoolittleGameplay: 5 lv13 cooking out of 2Graphics: Not enough Furrys 3 out of 5FINAL SCORE: 9 Papa John out of 10 Pizza Hut ITS'A MASTA PEECE

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 10, 2014
												If anything, Amazing World is a witty and well thought out Satire and created as an argument against modern MMO's released to the public. Instead of worrying about gearscore and using commands or a confusing skill bar of abilities, in the fashion of WoW, all enemies can be defeated simply by walking through them.  All quests are gathering and collecting, and the true reward is decorating your character and designing your own home. You actually have your own home you can design that many games and MMO's fail at.  You have to applaud Amazing World for being brave enough to slap every other game in the face, and it exists solely as a reminder that everyone needs to do better than it. The bar has been raised.10/10

												I was just a lonely guy...in a lonely place...but one day, the thug life chose me. I was in a tricked out car but then we were ambushed by Team Purple and capped almost all of us down. Me and my girl managed to escape and settled a new life with a new passport and a new identity. number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 8, 2014
												Never have I ever laid my eyes on such perfection. As soon as I started the game I knew it was going to be worth my while. I was blown away by the sheer amount of choices you were granted when choosing a character, which was an overwhelming total of 3. I chose the brown cow as my character and I was blessed with the family name of "Babyaniltongue" of which I hold great respect for. Upon arrival to Spring Bay, I almost broke into tears. I was completely and utterly flabbergasted by the amazing visuals this game possesses. The greenery looked as if I had stepped into a beautiful meadow, and the water looked so realistically ravishing that it made me feel parched and that the only way to quench my thirst was to drink of the holy waters of the game. I dare say this may be the best-looking game on Steam. After being delighted by the stimulative graphics, I was happy to see that the gameplay was just as gratifying. Not only do you have wasd as a choice of movement but the arrow keys as well, which is very useful for both right-handers and left-handers. There is no need for your mouse when navigating for you move only with the directional keys. The gameplay is very nonlinear and has much freedom. I was satisfied. This is indeed an MMO and you can play with others, as for chatting with them, only the parental-permitted players may do so. This is a high-grade, hardcore, horror/romantic/kawaii, video-game that is a must-buy. I give this a 10/10.

number of helpful: 5 of 10 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 7, 2014
												Quite possibly just set the bar as one of the most innovative and original mmo-games in the modern era of video gaming. The whole opening sequence made me feel as if I could do just about anything. The controls are superb, the action is fantastic, and the voice acting is amazing. On the subject of voice acting, the opening sequence between the characters played by Zooey Deschanel (New Girl) and Kate Mulgrew (Voyager) literally blew my mind. You start off on a flying air ship, (CRAZY ALREADY I KNOW) everything is cool, and you're getting a tour to familiarize yourself with the controls right? WRONG, you don't have time to familiarize yourself because the ship is invaded by weird creatures trying to tear it apart! (I PANIC) You're literally running around flailing your arms with no idea what to do! Trying to escape with the character played by Zooey Deschanel and she's terrified which means you can be the hero! Dodging dangerous falling timber, the crows nest almost crushes you, escaping just before one of the creatures ends up biting through the only thing keeping the ship afloat in the air!...... You and Zooey end up pushing a glider off of the ship!!! Holding on for dear life as you plummet down while the ship barrels through the air and into the murky black sea below!It's like Mass Effect (Excluding 3), Dragons Age, Elder Scrolls Oblivion, and My Little Pony were all caught sleeping together and when the baby finally came it was AMAZING WORLD.I am at a loss for words to describe exactly how I felt during the opening sequence of the game. Try it, it is less than a GIGABYTE (WHAT!?!?!? I KNOW!). I gaurantee whether you are a hardcore grinder, full on role play dude, just for the loot, or a weird dude who likes to play as a chick and fool other dudes into thinking that they are talking to a chick and then sends said person pictures of some chick they know on facebook only to tell them a year later after they fell in love with you that you're really not a chick but actually a dude and you have been messing with me the whole time and breaking my heart... this is the game you have been waiting for. If the opening sequence I described is not enough for you the game really picks up the pace (AS IF THAT WAS EVEN POSSIBLE!!!) once you land your glider, possible only after fighting through a fierce blizzard, while Zooey screams all the way down!

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 19, 2014
												I have been playing MMOs all of my life, I started with runescape at a very young age and ever since then I was hooked. As soon as I heard that World of Warcraft was coming into fruition, I knew that I had to check it out. It blew my mind, I was having so much fun and made many new friends in that game. Over time the game got easier and easier and was trying to appeal to the casual audience. Many of my friends left the game and it seemed like we could never find another game to fill the void in our hearts. We tried all of the MMOs we could find, but to no avail. Then, like magic, Amazing World appeared on steam. All of my friends flocked to this game like the lost sheep that we were. This game was hardcore to the most extreme. It chopped out the endless fluff that held other MMOs back, like a combat system, abilities, and group content. We obsessed over this game. We became the first guild to beat the 20 part simon says raid boss. Now we are the top tier MLG raid guild for amazing world and I could not be happier.In short, Amazing World is one of the most hardcore games on the steam store today. I Give the game a resounding 11/10 for exceeding even my most extreme expectations. Play today. It will change your life.

content:
Posted: October 7, 2014
												This game is really cute, and I did enjoy it a bit while playing, but like the other reviews said, it becomes p2p after level 10, and it doesn't take long at all to get to level 10. If you have the extra money to spare and you actually enjoy the game enough to pay to get a level higher than 10, it's a decent game. It's cute, and it can be used to entertain kids while babysitting or something, which is always useful. However, if you don't have the extra money to spend on a membership for this game, then I suppose it's not really worth playing. There are also some issues with achievements bugging out and that's annoying, because I'm an achivement hound and I thought this game would be a cute waste of time that I could get achievements for, but I've already had two achievements not unlock for me. Overall, I'd say it's an okay game, and it's cute, but with it becoming p2p after only about an hour of gameplay and the achievements bugging out, I can't really recommned it.

Posted: August 7, 2014
												When I think of Steam, I think of a more mature demographic whereas this game is definitely a child's game. Possibly targeted towards Steam players with children. It's a alright game with basic "go here, come back" and "find x amount of y" mechanics to get kids into gaming with basic little quests and whimisical story, music, and art. It even uses something similar to area wide cooperation quests to boost teamwork. It's a very basic low requirement game that I'm sure can run on decent computers. It's nonviolent so if you happened to want to keep your children from fighting and such, then here it is. The game is a free trial up until level 10, then you can purchase a membership, the lowest being 3.99 for a month to about 30 bucks for a year.Personally, I don't recommend this game mainly because this isn't what I think of when I think of Steam, but there's a possibility Valve is attempting to widen the playerbase, but still. I'm personally not a fan of children's games so I have to make this recommendation a "No."

content:
Posted: August 6, 2014
												It took me 10 mins.. 10 mins.. to realize this game is not ready for any type of release. When first entered the game, i was asked to make my name.. you get a selection of 3 characters.. You will then select your name.. after that it sends you over to the next task which makes you select your last name and it Glitched out and did not work, so i could not move on.. took me 5 restarts and tries before it worked, just when i thought maybe i am home free i realized i wasn't, i then has to run around touching some odd little animal kid things.. suddenly some type of boss game that i believe you were supposed to fight..well guess what i never got to fight the boss cause soon as the cut scene ended the game again glitched out and i was literally floating in the sky.. mean while im supposed to be fighting a boss that was clearly not flying in the sky with me.. To make matters worse.. in order to do this again you would have to start from beginning again.. NO THANKS. To make matters worse there was no options from what i seen that allow you to make any type of adjustments  resolution and anything else.. only thing i seen is an option at the top of the right hand side of the screen to close the screen, or switch it to full screen or Windowed mode.. and even while in windowed more you cannot scale it.. So far this game is total crap as it stands right now, i really do not have the patients to keep restarting the game because it keeps glitching out due to software issues. Update:So i made it past everything, and finally made it into the game, it wanted me to register my parents email? WTF? to make matters worse, once you sign up and all the fun stuff they want your parents to approve the email so you can chat in public chat lol.. why when i am playing this game do i feel as if "CHRIS HANSON" is following me around.I will continue to watch for updates and maybe try this game again later once they have fixed issues for now i don't recommend this game at all.

content:
Posted: August 19, 2014
												While some of the sections above may sound either fanboy-ish or cynical-old-man-ish, that’s simply because there are so many either really good or really bad things that come with Mists of Pandaria.Pros:    Once again the collector’s edition is gorgeous. Blizzard does CE versions very well, and this is no exception. Sure it is a few extra bucks, but for that you get a great looking box, a nice art book, a mouse pad, a DVD, a soundtrack CD, and an in game mount and pet.    The new Pandaren race and Monk class are both really nice additions to the game. I love the whole panda thing, and have since they were introduced way back in Warcraft as an April fools joke.    The Monk class is cool as well since it offers another hybrid class that can tank (my favorite spec). Better yet the tank spec is completely different than any other tank spec, making it a whole lot of fun to play.    The overall look and feel of the game, as well as the music, voice, and storytelling aspects. There are so many more cut scenes included that the game feels like I am participating in a movie rather than just playing a game. It also helps that once again Blizzard has nailed the story lines in each zone, and that really pulls me into the game.    The new dungeons and raids look stunning and are a whole lot of fun to play. While the dungeons are not as hard as the Cataclysm ones were initially, they do have a lot more going on in them. Blizzard has really started to add more abilities to dungeon bosses since Cataclysm, and that makes them much more interesting to fight against.    For once the launch went amazingly well! The game just flowed right into the launch and while there was some congestion at key points in quest chains, there was never a serious holdup. This was probably the best launch yet for a WoW expansion.    Cons        The leveling in the game is once again way to fast. It is just insane to me that after all this waiting for a game players can power through it in less than a day. Sure there is a lot of end game content, and that is what most players want to get to, but it was still too fast by far.        The whole idea of adding Pokemon to the game is more than a little strange to me. While I know the idea is popular with the younger crowd, it seems downright disrespectful to the more serious gamers.        While scenarios looked to be an awesome idea, they fall seriously short. They are way to easy and require way to little cooperation to offer any serious lasting enjoyment.        The simplified talent system is just way to simplified. While I do agree that it offers more meaningful choice when compared to the old talent system, it does so at the expense of a feel of accomplishment or customization. Getting 1 talent every 15 levels doesn’t feel like you are accomplishing anything or able to customize your character at all. Worst of all, all specializations for each class all have access to the same talents. I can think of only one word to describe that: lame.

content:
Posted: August 7, 2014
												My friends, I hope you're sitting down. It would probably be weird if you weren't, since you're most likely at a computer. What, you got some kinda standing desk? You think you're better than me?You have never before seen a game like this. While Elder Scrolls Online was busy whoring attention and clogging up all the hype in the MMO market, Amazing World quietly slipped in and is poised to take the market by storm. If you're one of those ♥♥♥♥ing ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s who loves getting in on huge things before they become huge, then jump your sweet, bulbous booty right onto Amazing World right now, because I can tell you that this game is about to blow. The ♥♥♥♥. Up. The control scheme is so god damned tight that you only need four keys and a mouse to do everything-hotkeys are a thing of the past, people! We all know mouse clicks are far faster and more accurate than key presses. With an engaging storyline, riveting, nuanced combat, and abundance of content for both beginners and endgame, Amazing World outclasses any MMO I've played before. Trust me, I've played 'em all: WoW, Perfect World, RIFT, Neverwinter, Ragnarok Online, Ragnarok Online 2, Gaia, MapleShit, and even Elder Scrolls Online. All fall flat on their faces when compared to Amazing World. The graphics are so tight, it's no wonder this is a PC exclusive. With draw distances of almost five feet and incredible 240p textures, it's like you're experiencing this--dare I say--AMAZING world in real life, especially since I can guarantee your "real" life will disappear after you become as addicted to Amazing World as everyone who experiences this incredible phenomenon does. I rate this game a 9.8/10. GOTY. Thank you based RIOT, Garen confirmed for best champion.

That being said, amazing world, you have a dumb little place in my heart.

content:
Posted: January 17, 2015
												The Amazing World is an MMO designed for children. The designer's consider it a collectible game akin to that of beanie babies. The point is to collect all the rare clothing and critter skins you can whilst levelling up.The problem? You have to be a VIP with a valid credit card to level up past ten.That does suck, but you are able to level up skills like cookin and such (which serve no purpose other than collecting skins clothes and furniture items).You may also use steam cash to pay for gold coins for more skins and special clothes.I would say anyone complaining about this game for the fact that it forces you to buy VIP after level 10 have missed the fact that VIP isnt even worth it because you can still earn your way to skins and rewards by levelling up your SKILLS. Not your XP level. So technically, you dont have to pay to play its an option and a really stupid one at that because you can earn everything in the game vips get off the bat and the mini games are designed for kids 5 and up. So its pretty damn easy to just spam missions to level skills for clothes and stuff. Other than that the game is cute and fun. But dont bother if you're looking for an epic mmo. This is quite literally, a kids game.

Amazing World - despite the apparent simplicity and kindness includes all: and leveling, and multiplayer, and quests and mini-games of different genres, relatively open world, as well as editor of character and a lot of interesting things.At the beginning of the game to choose from available in all 3 classes:●Mage (calf)●Berserker (bear)●Archer (Bunny)Next you will find a peaceful good game up to attack the evil insidious lilac enotikov ... And now have to explore a new world, swing skills, search for treasure and complete quests to hunt for reklikviyami, etc., etc.. You can even build a house and arrange well the territory around it.The drawback of the game is very hard Donat, the in-game store a ton of gear, at some point it becomes clear that no further reals will be very tight.As for the cartoon and the age restriction. Like the universe, My Little Pony game attracts some adults older than 18 years, as well as ordinary people with a good sense of humor (see. content:
Posted: June 5, 2016
												Where to start.I recommend that if you are like me and you want to look like the coolest animal out there, then don't play this game. If you just want a game to play to pass the time, then go for it. One problem is actually a personal problem. One thing I don't like about this game is that there are certain quests where you have to pick up items. I am an impatient person, so when I got the item off the floor, I would be unable to move for 4 or 5 seconds. This really grinds my gears.The main problem is that it is a pay to get anything. I came into this game because I thought it looked cute and I thought I was going to be able to buy all the outfits and unlock all the achievements. I later on realized that you can't get all the achievements because there is a level cap for non-members. The level cap for members is 50 while for normal players it is 10. Since the level cap is 10, a perosn can only buy the level 10 outfits in the world store. I want to look cool when I play, so I would have liked to buy the cooler clothes. The second problem with the level cap is that there are only 4 NPC's that can give someone quests that is a non-member. You need to be a higher level to take quests from other NPC's and the game gets somewhat repetitive with the same 4.All in all, I would have to say it is an okay game

content:
Posted: July 12, 2016
												I was able to do drugs and hang out with my new friends in Amazing World. I really like the PvP system where you can fight other players around town and kill the NPCs while doing it. Obviously the NPCs respawn after awhile. The twist with the PvP is that it's permanent death, so you have to make a new character if you die. What I really like is that it's pretty much GTA and that Naughty Bear game combined into one great MMO for everyone 17+. Letting your kids play this is a big mistake, as I have seen a few kids get PTSD from playing. The guides are also really helpful in surviving this game's complex system. Membership is totally worth it, trust me. You get the option to be in the Mafia once you buy the membership.

content:
Posted: January 18, 2015
												Not too sure what to write here so heres a recipe for Pancakes insteadIngredients:1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour3 tablespoons sugar1 tablespoon baking powder1/4 teaspoon salt1/8 teaspoon freshly ground nutmeg2 large eggs, at room temperature1 1/4 cups milk, at room temperature1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract3 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus more as neededNow to make it1. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg.2. In another bowl, beat the eggs and then whisk in the milk and vanilla.3. Melt the butter in a large cast iron skillet or griddle over medium heat.4. Whisk the butter into the milk mixture. Add the wet ingredients to the flour mixture, and whisk until a thick batter is just formed5. Keeping the skillet at medium heat, ladle about 1/4 cup of the batter onto the skillet, to make a pancake. Make 1 or 2 more pancakes, taking care to keep them evenly spaced apart. Cook, until bubbles break the surface of the pancakes, and the undersides are golden brown, about 2 minutes. Flip with a spatula and cook about 1 minute more on the second side. Serve immediately or transfer to a platter and cover loosely with foil to keep warm. Repeat with the remaining batter, adding more butter to the skillet as needed.6. Procedure for adding fruit to pancakes: Once the bubbles break the surface of the pancakes, scatter the surface with sliced or diced fruit, or chocolate chips, nuts, etc. Flip with a spatula and cook for 1 minute more, being careful not to burn toppings.

content:
Posted: June 14, 2016
												Never before have I experienced gameplay as astoundingly superb and visuals as pristine and beautiful as that of Amazing World. Released for the Nintendo Gamecube November 17, 2001, Amazing World has become a huge hit in a nitch community that widely regards it as the definitive best competitive video game of all time. Amazing World isn't just a game, it's an experience. it is a eat, breathe, sleep, drink, and feel in ways you've never felt before. After playing Amazing World for the first time I was promptly sucked off by 100 4 year olds at the same time. Never before have I experienced such orgastic sensations. Overall, Amazing World is just as the name implies; Amazing. Never before has any game reached the magnitude of influence on my life this one has. Needless to say, Amazing World is by far the greatest work of art ever to be created by mankind. 7.8/10 too much water.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2015
												Ok considering the target audience is the child-population this game is a great start. BUT - Like so many of my other "Just Curious Reviews" - it is not for the avid gamer, nor is it intended in any form to be similiar to a "real" MMORPG - although it advertises "violence free" there are enemies, but there's no attack animation, and the mobs just disappear when you run into them. Obviously not worth downloading if your above 13 years old or so, since you can find plenty of more age-appropriate games by then. Like it or not violence is the key to existence in the MMO market, or any sufficently advanced game market. Just putting it under cloak and dagger is not "violence free" it's "delaying the inevitable". BUT - Children need not be exposed to such until they are ready so this is a good go-between. Due to the wardrobe design I don't think this game's "Dress-up" was aimed at anything more than a 2 -  3 year old, and certainly is not "girly" enough to be aimed explicitly at girls (or the odd curious boy who likes things like that). Additionally as I feared before downloading it does not support humanoid player characters, quite the shame.

content:
Posted: October 20, 2014
												I had downloaded this game for fun, I heard it gave people cancer and I thought to myself,"Surely it can't be this bad".  And you know what? It wasn't, well, it was but more on that later. So anyways, there is a lot of good mmorpg games (if you can even call this game that) and fortunately, this isn't one of them. From what I can tell of the 10 minutes I played this game, it is this rpg type of game kinda like club penguin except way worse, and my main problem was, it wasn't fun, I found my self just walking around this town filled with five year olds who enjoy this game and I just couldn't wrap my head around it, I'd be running around, looking for a quest, and I couldn't find anything, the game had a real big pay2play problem kinda like tf2 but not really because in team fortress you can find items and it's not really pay2play. I spun this large wheel and I got 125 coins, what did I do with them? Absolutely nothing, I couldn't buy anything because I didn't have enough coins or I was a low level. In all honesty, don't waste your time on this game, please. There's much better games that are free to play like teamfortress, quake live,etc. And they are a million times better than this peice of trash, do I recommend this game? no, with the crappy mechanics it has, the crappy pay2play system and on top of that, theres no fighting, I understand it's a kids game, but c'mon there are some kids games that are better and still bad, but have a combat system. This game is trash and I will never recommend it. Don't waste your time and money. All in all, this game didn't give me cancer though, it gave me aids, darn.
