content:
Posted: January 4, 2015
												(I played in a browser so the time on steam isn't correct) The game is great and provides many challenges, innovating gameplay and lots of loot to collect such as a squid backpack. It does however requires payment after lv 10 but you can go on playing quite a bit after that anyway. There are many proffesions in the game to level up so it's quite similar to Runescape. These include stuff like fishing, cooking and archeology. These have very deep mechanics and you can use the resources for many different things.The game is heavily inspired by Guild Wars 2 as well with world events appearing randomly everywhere. Together with your zing comrades, you have to complete them and you get rewarded based on how well you did. The game also provides a great PvP component where you have to battle other zings in the events to become the leading helper and get the greatest reward.Other features that are great include: Player housing. You can customise your garden, yard, house and many other thing with the gear you aquire in quests. Speaking of quests, this is another great aspect of the game.There are many questlines, each with unique skill rewards and loot. The quests range from simple "collect x things" to puzzles, racing, platforming and shooting segments. The questlines never get repetetive and thanks to a well made fast travelling mechanic, the game never gets tedious.Simply put, this is a great mmorpg with lots of variety. The game borrows mechanics from other games to create a truly refined and unique experience. The only downside is the membership requirment after lv 10. (max lv is 50). But the cost is low at 2,99 $ a month and I deeply recommend it for that cost.This is a game that deserves attention because of its finely crafted experience. Add me in game, my name is JiggleTitts. I give this game 9/10.

number of helpful: 0 of 3 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 8, 2015
												After leveling up my Bovine Paladin, I have found that This game has given me a new found outlook on life in general. The bright colors and textures have shown me that I should open up my eyes more and glance at the world in a upright and colorful manner. All of the creative outfits you can put on your zing reflect who you are as a whole. You CAN be unique. You ARE your own person. Who says you center wear an eggshell as a hat? Who says you can't be the swaggiest ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ out there? In This game you, too, can make your dreams come true! With a captivating story line and top of the year graphics, there is nothing you can't not like about Amazing World. It simply is Amazing!With many other features such as trick or treating for halloween and egg hunts during Easter, we can get crunk while praising the lord!Plus you can get coins and buy all kinds of hella sweet swag for your zing. 110% customizable, you can look better than all your friends. Let's be honest, who doesn't want to be the cool kid in your group of friends? With the affordable price of 4 dollars a month, you can have unlimited access to all of This plus more!Who needs CS:GO? Who needs TF2? C'mon. We both know those games are for ♥♥♥♥ anyways! Be the leader of your group of friends; be the one who starts a revolution. Get Amazing World.

content:
Posted: March 11
												I liked the artwork and the early story line; the early script and voice acting is much better than some more mature games I've played  - though it looks like it is designed for small children (in which case not sure why it's on steam seeing as you need to be 13 to use Steam), people with a simple mental capability need or those who like EXTREME in casual gaming. You are forced to be nice by filters in a multiplayer make believe world where you choose a character, dress it and design a home. To obtain decor and clothing you must complete simple quests with very easy puzzles or tasks and simple minigames to earn currency and/or items (some of which you can use in crafting.) On the plus side to being simple, it's impossible for people to be rude, irritating or steal your stuff!The membership is not expensive but the microtransactions for items are; by the time you've bought anything worth having you could have bought a much better fully functioning game with less bugs and without extra costs of membership and dumb microtransactions.

content:
Posted: August 5, 2015
												My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

												While the sub fee of this game is almost nothing compared to a standard a MMO, at $30 per year, the game is not F2P, and is fundamentally a demo.I was very very interested in playing this game to see if a Kid's focused MMO could make the game, and it is, from the short of it, well made (or, at least, not thrown together haphazardly like so many wowclones)However, Valve doesn't give a damn about steam, because it just prints money, and now I can't even launch the game.Wish I could downvote Steam proper, but whatever.But, at this point, I have to recommend it, because it is Valve's fault for this posting, and the game is 2 years sub fee for the cost of a single AAA title...So ♥♥♥♥ valve, but try this game if you want to try something a little familiar but a little different.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 5, 2015
												Amazing World is a fun little MMO aimed at a younger audience. That in no way means you should feel bad for playing it! Everyone can enjoy their time in Spring Bay! To help you make the most of the game, I recommend disabling chat and going it alone. The stories are charming and the characters are unique and surprisingly well developed. You don’t need to talk to the other players, even in cooperative games, and if you’re respectfully uncomfortable interacting with children, you’re better off not talking at all. I also recommend purchasing a one month membership, as you’ll probably be able to finish everything in that time and you can continue playing for free afterword. The benefits of being a member are numerous and well worth the small initial price to unlock the full game. You do not need to invest in optional decorations and additional playable characters, so the micro transaction system shouldn’t be a deal breaker for anyone. You can complete all of the character’s stories and secure a wide variety of items and properties without buying more in-game currency. You won’t, however, be able to get all of the achievements.

content:
Posted: September 8, 2015
												A lot of people might give this game a bad review because they feel out of place and don't like the monthly fee. Well firstly, this game is made for kids, so no wonder you feel out of place. I quit after hitting 10 and being unable to progress, but it felt like the perfect game for kids, and even I was getting into it.As for the subscription, microtransactions would be bad in a game meant for kids. Subscription is simple, the parents decide if it's worth the money, then just pay once a month. What do little kids want with gear or exp boosters? Kids play games to actually have fun, not get to the top of the leaderboards.Overall, I highly recommend this game to any parents looking for a fun game for their kids (probably 9 and younger, but older works too if they like more simplistic pacifist gameplay), if you don't mind paying a monthly fee.

content:
Posted: April 17, 2015
												First i want to say, that the term "Free to play" needs to be redefined.You can play for free until you become level 10, (You can still play, but not advance on your main xp) then you have to subscribe to a monthly membership.There are two kinds of progression, the XP and SP. you get SP (skill points) for certian missions, such as cooking, science, depending on which chacters you speak to. These missions and skills can be played and leveled foreverSome of the characters require you to be a certain level to speak with them (XP lvl), and that's the one that will only get to level 10 for free playersIt's a cute MMO, or just MO, it is not that massive. You run around questing, doing different mini games, chat with others, decorate you house, or whatever you feel like.decorations and outfits can be earned doing quest, or be bought using either in-game cash or eshop coins. I cannot comment on the story or what happens after a certain point in the game since i did not pay, but I enjoyed it, and would recommend it though its unfortunate free players don't get more than a small demo.

content:
Posted: June 26, 2015
												Playing the first 10 minutes, it was fun. The game is clearly aimed at children, but as an adult (or perhaps I'm still a kid at heart?), this game seemed fun. Upon starting, you're on an airship as a teddy animal creature. You're heading to a new home, peaceful lands, ect, ect. Soon, an evil queen wants to wreck the world (Natural MMO storyline) and you've got to move into town to stop her. Ok, seems fun so far! Story quests to complete, simple game mechanics... Oh wait, did you forget to mention the part where 'free to play' secretly means 'we want your money because 'Insert reason here'.Yes, this game MAY be advertised as 'Free to Play', but it's so full of Microtransactions, it might as well be 'Free to Download'. I'd say steer away from this game, unless you plan to fork out for a lot of stuff

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 8, 2015
												A lot of people might give this game a bad review because they feel out of place and don't like the monthly fee. Well firstly, this game is made for kids, so no wonder you feel out of place. I quit after hitting 10 and being unable to progress, but it felt like the perfect game for kids, and even I was getting into it.As for the subscription, microtransactions would be bad in a game meant for kids. Subscription is simple, the parents decide if it's worth the money, then just pay once a month. What do little kids want with gear or exp boosters? Kids play games to actually have fun, not get to the top of the leaderboards.Overall, I highly recommend this game to any parents looking for a fun game for their kids (probably 9 and younger, but older works too if they like more simplistic pacifist gameplay), if you don't mind paying a monthly fee.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 28, 2015
												I both recommend and not recommend this game depending on what you're looking for. To be fair this game is free to play, but you are very limited if you keep it free. On another note, the subscription to enjoy the perks is also quite cheap but its still debatable to me whether its actually worth it, then again, although my inner child loves this, my inner child is also older than 8 and after a few hours of gameplay gets very bored. ACHIEVEMENT HUNTERS BEWARE!! The BAD stuff...Free to Play yes, but note that if you want ALL achievements or want to make it past level 10 you need to pay for a subsciption and spend over $100USD in the end to unlock everything. While the game is cute and friendly and great for kids, player beware your kids playing this will bug the hell out of you for all the premium stuff you cant get without spending the money. Although i can safely add my experience with it and that of my kids has been enjoyable, and safe (in regards to language filters, safety etc.) there are better things out there just as safe for kids that make premium stuff optional and do not impact the overall game enjoyment. If you want something safe for kids, better to sign them up for Neopets than this. I'll be stopping my subscription soon, its really not worth it. GOOD THINGS TO NOTE:If you're happy with the limited gameplay without a subscription or a vitual babysitter for small children (and i mean any older than 8 or they may start to get bored after a time) then i would actually recommend it. The graphics are adorable, pastel and colorful and certainly it does have a lot of potential. There are a number of mini games that are fun as well and rewards for winners that just enhance your character for a small duration of the time. Play out character quests to increase how they interact with you and see their stories develop. Make friends, play tag, collect your daily prizes from the wheel. Also note while curse words, common names, numbers and various religious words are screened, combinations of harmless word phrases to make obscene refs are not, so a parent has to ask themselves, "Will my child be smart enough to realize these references are rude or am i just being paranoid?". Unless your child is early teens like 10 onwards they likely wont get any of them and like childhood innocense find them hilarious. There is the option to report players anyway if necessary. The environment in general is friendly, and bad stuff doesnt exist. No evil, just miscrevious little creatures that cause problems sometimes. Your child will at least be safe here in this fantasy land of no death, gore and where everything is sugarpop rainbows with sprinkles on top~!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 17, 2015
												First i want to say, that the term "Free to play" needs to be redefined.You can play for free until you become level 10, (You can still play, but not advance on your main xp) then you have to subscribe to a monthly membership.There are two kinds of progression, the XP and SP. you get SP (skill points) for certian missions, such as cooking, science, depending on which chacters you speak to. These missions and skills can be played and leveled foreverSome of the characters require you to be a certain level to speak with them (XP lvl), and that's the one that will only get to level 10 for free playersIt's a cute MMO, or just MO, it is not that massive. You run around questing, doing different mini games, chat with others, decorate you house, or whatever you feel like.decorations and outfits can be earned doing quest, or be bought using either in-game cash or eshop coins. I cannot comment on the story or what happens after a certain point in the game since i did not pay, but I enjoyed it, and would recommend it though its unfortunate free players don't get more than a small demo.

												Amazing World is a much different kind of mmo instead of fighting action packed you get cute funny little animals. It focuses on taking care of your very own garden and help the the town from being took over by the Queen Vexa. Now your more of just running up to the nix and scaring em off but theres a lot more to the game then all that. Theirs cute and fun minigames that seem to be different every time to from a mario like side scroller to riding a cute little car or even fixing puzzles.  The down side of it is once you hit level 10 you hit the end of the road for free to play. Now $4 a month seems reasonable to me for this funny little game but if you don't pay no more game for you! Its would be good for any age as long as they like cute.

content:
Posted: January 19, 2015
												This game literally blew my ♥♥♥♥ing mind. I'm 27 years old now, and I've been gaming solidly for 19 years. I have to say, I have never come across a game which lived up to its name quite so well before. Amazing World will leave you speachless with both it's ingenius design and its beautiful graphics. The community of fellow "Zings" is fantastic, and any time you feel threatened by Nixx's they will help you.I rate this game a solid, gold plater, grade A 10/10, and I would genuinely recommend this video game experience, or master piece as I like to call it, to anyone who has the audacity to play something this ground breaking and revolutionary. This game will be the eulogy played out at my funeral for I believe that from this point onwards it will define who I am.Amazing World is the gift to the human race that God wishes he could give.Five Stars, please play. I am in no way affiliated with this game or the Zing people. Just an awe struck fan, turned away from the dark side of triple A filth. Take my ♥♥♥♥ing word for it, it will change your life for the better. Since I began playing Amazing World, I have felt physically and mentally healthier and my sex life has improved. I think it may even have the power to cure cancer.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 20, 2014
												Amazing World is an interesting idea, and one that I can honestly say I enjoy almost completely. Despite being a child's MMO game, it has enough in it to interest most MMO fans, at least to a certain degree.Originally, I downloaded this game on my sister's laptop to see if she would enjoy it (she didn't really have anything except The Sims 2 & 3). We were both instantly drawn in to the cutesy style and well-designed world that the game presented, and played it for a day straight, max-leveling one of the accouts we made to the highest non-pay level. Once we got back home, I downloaded it on THIS steam account to see if the multiplayer worked. Amazing World is similar to Skyrim in that you cannot play it for just a few minutes, at least if you enjoy the game. Whilst I initally only went on to try the multiplayer, I ended up completing a full character story and earning about 6000 coins!Speaking of characters, all are well-voiced and each have their own personalities. While I won't list them all, the best by far were Annoying (a navi-like little probe robot with a very teenage-girl-like attitude and style of speech) and Brick (a carpenter who sees himself as fearless but gets scared very easily). Whilst some are locked until levels higher than 10, the ones that we have had a chance to meet are charming and well-made.Overall, whilst I do enjoy the game, I always feel a bit awkward playing it seperately to my sister (since we spent a while playing it on the same device at the same time). It's worth at least an hour or two of play even if you don't like anything about it. As my sister said, "it's Moshi Monsters, but better".

Posted: September 1, 2014
												Who cares what about what people who have played this game for ten minutes say. You can't just play a game for 0.2 hours and then confidently  declare it's a piece of crap. Go away. Bye.This game reminds me reminds me of Webkinz, also made by Ganz, and Toontown, a game by Disney recently shut down. I love both of those games and it was nice to see a combination of them. You pretty much just run around doing quests for various people around town. This game is meant for little children, so it does get a bit repetitive, but I still enjoyed it for the time I've played and I think I'll play a little more too. I would definitely recommend this to someone who likes MMO games made for younger audiences.

												This game literally blew my ♥♥♥♥ing mind. I'm 27 years old now, and I've been gaming solidly for 19 years. I have to say, I have never come across a game which lived up to its name quite so well before. Amazing World will leave you speachless with both it's ingenius design and its beautiful graphics. The community of fellow "Zings" is fantastic, and any time you feel threatened by Nixx's they will help you.I rate this game a solid, gold plater, grade A 10/10, and I would genuinely recommend this video game experience, or master piece as I like to call it, to anyone who has the audacity to play something this ground breaking and revolutionary. This game will be the eulogy played out at my funeral for I believe that from this point onwards it will define who I am.Amazing World is the gift to the human race that God wishes he could give.Five Stars, please play. I am in no way affiliated with this game or the Zing people. Just an awe struck fan, turned away from the dark side of triple A filth. Take my ♥♥♥♥ing word for it, it will change your life for the better. Since I began playing Amazing World, I have felt physically and mentally healthier and my sex life has improved. I think it may even have the power to cure cancer.

												Before anyone says anything did i play a game made for mental paitients and babies? Yeh i did, And did i like the game? Yes i did, And you know what it don't care. Sure this game wasn't World Of Warcraft brilliant but what do you expect from a childrens MMO game?For a kids game though the open world was kind of impressive, Like i said before not WOW open world but still not bad for a kids game. The graphics aren't to bad either and the open world looks pretty as an old man flying away on a frat boy with wings.  (Wich if you didn't realise is very beautiful). One thing that made me ammazed is that you can levelup, gain money, do main story quest, side quest and even upgrade your home!I was also supprised that this game ran smoothly, I didn't have a single bit of lag through out my hole play through. Anyway now on to the main part of any game the gameplay.The game controls like resident eveil on pc wich takes a while to get used to. Most of the game consits of gardening, running around and doing chores and possible a few home decorations along the way. And it was fairly enjoyable.I like this game and guess what should i care that i do? NO I SHOULDN'T I DON'T GIVE A SINGLE♥♥♥♥♥♥ DON'T YOU DARE SENSER ME STEAM!....Son of a ♥♥♥♥♥. Anyways now to my final result of this game. And i would give it a.7.5 out of ten.Yes for someone who isn't a little kid this game would be meh. But for a little kid its brilliant and thats the way i have to review it, Through the eyes of a little kid.Anyways im gonna go play with my crossdresser in this game see you later!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 7, 2014
												I'll admit it, I love quirky, childish-looking MMOs. I always have. Be it Grand Fantasia from Aeria Games, or this particular MMO, something draws me to them. I played this game for two hours before writing this review. I love the art style, the bright colors, the whimsical nature of the game itself. I was a bit concerned with the fact that it is only F2P for the first 10 LEVELS, with any leveling past that requiring a subscription (monthly, 6-month, or yearly). I appreciate the fact that it is marketed toward children, because there aren't a lot of child-marketed MMOs for burgeoning gamers (like my neice). However, I think the game should be like many other F2P that include subscription services in that the features are only lightly restrictive, not to the point that you CANNOT LEVEL AT ALL past 10. I will say this - the voice acting was nice, the characters are quirky, and I enjoy the humor. It is also runs very well on my netbook. I like that it has elements reminiscent of Mabinogi or Villagers and Heroes (fishing, owning and decorating a home, a garden), but I'd love to see what else this game has to offer. I suppose I'll cough up the $3.99 for at least one month to see how it goes. All in all, despite the issue with the restrictions on F2P members, I really enjoyed what little I've played of this game and will likely continue. I'd give it a 7/10 at this time. Give it a shot, at least.

content:
Posted: August 16, 2014
												Amazing World is the most horrific game I have ever played, heck, let alone game, it's the most horrific THING I've ever witnessed! Torture is a common theme in this psychological game, as the game's known merciless villain, Bloom, frequently feeds off of the tortured animals in her basement. Oh god the horror of this game. The Springs village has blood everywhere, rotten animal organs around every corner, with painful sounding moans, screams and wimpers as the game's soundtrack. One of the most effective part is where there's a scene where the character of "Twinkle" is decapitated slowly and painfully by rusty nail clippers in an incredibly explicit scene where you can see all of the pain in her crying face while it happens. Amazing World changed my life. It showed me how wonderful my life truly is for not living in this horrid civilisation, and I'm rethinking any negative thought I've ever had in my life. Which is why Amazing World is my favourite video game, heck, favourite THING in the known universe.Masterpiece.

content:
Posted: August 20, 2014
												Amazing World is an interesting idea, and one that I can honestly say I enjoy almost completely. Despite being a child's MMO game, it has enough in it to interest most MMO fans, at least to a certain degree.Originally, I downloaded this game on my sister's laptop to see if she would enjoy it (she didn't really have anything except The Sims 2 & 3). We were both instantly drawn in to the cutesy style and well-designed world that the game presented, and played it for a day straight, max-leveling one of the accouts we made to the highest non-pay level. Once we got back home, I downloaded it on THIS steam account to see if the multiplayer worked. Amazing World is similar to Skyrim in that you cannot play it for just a few minutes, at least if you enjoy the game. Whilst I initally only went on to try the multiplayer, I ended up completing a full character story and earning about 6000 coins!Speaking of characters, all are well-voiced and each have their own personalities. While I won't list them all, the best by far were Annoying (a navi-like little probe robot with a very teenage-girl-like attitude and style of speech) and Brick (a carpenter who sees himself as fearless but gets scared very easily). Whilst some are locked until levels higher than 10, the ones that we have had a chance to meet are charming and well-made.Overall, whilst I do enjoy the game, I always feel a bit awkward playing it seperately to my sister (since we spent a while playing it on the same device at the same time). It's worth at least an hour or two of play even if you don't like anything about it. As my sister said, "it's Moshi Monsters, but better".

content:
Posted: August 13, 2014
												Well to begin with the game is VERY cute. It is very easy to pick up and play and is child-friendly. There are definitely some bugs, but this is a new game so there is definitely hope of them getting fixed too. The first character I made I lost because when it got to the registration part it didn't work. I could not put in a username at all. So I restarted the game, made a new character, and then it worked. I was enjoying it until I kept getting very laggy as I phased in and out during the beginning quests, after you get to the town. Then I noticed a lot of adverts for membership. I also noticed some microtransactions. So this game is geared towards children and yet requires you to throw money at it. In my opinion, I do not like this. I feel like it lures kids in and then requires a membership and microtransactions for them to enjoy it. Its like baking a cake in front of a kid and then letting them lick the icing off of the spatula and then telling them to ask their parents for money so they can have a slice. So I guess this game is fine if you don't mind throwing money at a buggy game for your kid.TL;DR very cute, very easy to play, very buggy, needs membership and microtransactions to be fully enjoyed

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 5, 2015
												Amazing World is a fun little MMO aimed at a younger audience. That in no way means you should feel bad for playing it! Everyone can enjoy their time in Spring Bay! To help you make the most of the game, I recommend disabling chat and going it alone. The stories are charming and the characters are unique and surprisingly well developed. You don’t need to talk to the other players, even in cooperative games, and if you’re respectfully uncomfortable interacting with children, you’re better off not talking at all. I also recommend purchasing a one month membership, as you’ll probably be able to finish everything in that time and you can continue playing for free afterword. The benefits of being a member are numerous and well worth the small initial price to unlock the full game. You do not need to invest in optional decorations and additional playable characters, so the micro transaction system shouldn’t be a deal breaker for anyone. You can complete all of the character’s stories and secure a wide variety of items and properties without buying more in-game currency. You won’t, however, be able to get all of the achievements.

content:
Posted: September 23, 2016
												Despite being a young man with little money to my name, I relatively enjoyed this game. However, this is more ideal for anyone 12 and under, who have access to their parents' credit card.Pros Hello Kitty-esque game art for lolis. (What can I say? I like pastels.) Cute character choices that make one squeal like a girl. (Guilty. Don't care.) Hilarious randomly generated names such as "Pompenstance". Somewhat cringey dialouge that's actually amusing. Adorable outfits and accessories for your character. (Wow. I felt really gay typing that.)Cons Plot holes that leave you confused and in the dust. (Like did I not help on ship? And who is Vexa?) Poor camera and movement controls. Dead end quests that you can't fulfill due to glitches. Poor mini game designs with wonky controls. Poor shop design accompanied by a somewhat confusing monetary system. Level capping that you end up reaching without difficulty. Forces you to pay membership if you wish to get past the level cap.As you can see, the cons end up out-weighing the pros. Play it if you wish. But keep in mind that if you don't want to pay for a membership, your time playing this game will be short lived.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 14, 2014
												This game is literally the best thing I've ever seen on Steam. I saw the game on the free to play list, and wasn't expecting much. Free games aren't always the most fun, but for some reason, this caught my attention. I installed it immediately, but then realized that all players had to register with their parents' information. I feared lying to the game, and knew that they only wanted to protect me, as the game is safe for children of all ages. After much begging, I finally got my parents' approval for this breathtaking game, and was ready to begin my journey. I entered the game, immediately blown away. These cute cartoons, these loveable characters, they were all so colorful, and just beautiful! The THREE different types of characters were so similar, yet at the same time, they all held a different story, ready to be created by the player, and after much debate, I settled with the blue bunny. There were about a whole five different outfits to choose from, and I was already very pleased with the amount of choices I was already given. I have never been so awestruck by a game before. I made my way through the tutorial, gasping at every turn of events the story held for me, and crying along with the characters at every scene that pulled my heartstrings. I had never experienced a more moving tale before. Once I passed the tutorial, I was transported into a town with many other players, all of which were enjoying the game just as much as me. The chat filter the game held protecting me, as well as the other gamers from any profanities, such as the words "loser", "freak", "suck", and anything of that nature. After putting so much time and effort into playing this game, I was very pleased with the results. It is a beautiful game, probably the best I've ever played. All of you should immediately download and play this game.In all honesty, this game would suck unless you're around the age of three. I gave it a try to troll the kids in it, but the chat filter is incredibly silly, and prevented my friends and I from saying any even slightly profanic words. I wish you luck if you are willing to play this xD.

												This game is literally the best thing I've ever seen on Steam. I saw the game on the free to play list, and wasn't expecting much. Free games aren't always the most fun, but for some reason, this caught my attention. I installed it immediately, but then realized that all players had to register with their parents' information. I feared lying to the game, and knew that they only wanted to protect me, as the game is safe for children of all ages. After much begging, I finally got my parents' approval for this breathtaking game, and was ready to begin my journey. I entered the game, immediately blown away. These cute cartoons, these loveable characters, they were all so colorful, and just beautiful! The THREE different types of characters were so similar, yet at the same time, they all held a different story, ready to be created by the player, and after much debate, I settled with the blue bunny. There were about a whole five different outfits to choose from, and I was already very pleased with the amount of choices I was already given. I have never been so awestruck by a game before. I made my way through the tutorial, gasping at every turn of events the story held for me, and crying along with the characters at every scene that pulled my heartstrings. I had never experienced a more moving tale before. Once I passed the tutorial, I was transported into a town with many other players, all of which were enjoying the game just as much as me. The chat filter the game held protecting me, as well as the other gamers from any profanities, such as the words "loser", "freak", "suck", and anything of that nature. After putting so much time and effort into playing this game, I was very pleased with the results. It is a beautiful game, probably the best I've ever played. All of you should immediately download and play this game.In all honesty, this game would suck unless you're around the age of three. I gave it a try to troll the kids in it, but the chat filter is incredibly silly, and prevented my friends and I from saying any even slightly profanic words. I wish you luck if you are willing to play this xD.

content:
Posted: April 17, 2015
												First i want to say, that the term "Free to play" needs to be redefined.You can play for free until you become level 10, (You can still play, but not advance on your main xp) then you have to subscribe to a monthly membership.There are two kinds of progression, the XP and SP. you get SP (skill points) for certian missions, such as cooking, science, depending on which chacters you speak to. These missions and skills can be played and leveled foreverSome of the characters require you to be a certain level to speak with them (XP lvl), and that's the one that will only get to level 10 for free playersIt's a cute MMO, or just MO, it is not that massive. You run around questing, doing different mini games, chat with others, decorate you house, or whatever you feel like.decorations and outfits can be earned doing quest, or be bought using either in-game cash or eshop coins. I cannot comment on the story or what happens after a certain point in the game since i did not pay, but I enjoyed it, and would recommend it though its unfortunate free players don't get more than a small demo.

content:
Posted: September 23, 2016
												Despite being a young man with little money to my name, I relatively enjoyed this game. However, this is more ideal for anyone 12 and under, who have access to their parents' credit card.Pros Hello Kitty-esque game art for lolis. (What can I say? I like pastels.) Cute character choices that make one squeal like a girl. (Guilty. Don't care.) Hilarious randomly generated names such as "Pompenstance". Somewhat cringey dialouge that's actually amusing. Adorable outfits and accessories for your character. (Wow. I felt really gay typing that.)Cons Plot holes that leave you confused and in the dust. (Like did I not help on ship? And who is Vexa?) Poor camera and movement controls. Dead end quests that you can't fulfill due to glitches. Poor mini game designs with wonky controls. Poor shop design accompanied by a somewhat confusing monetary system. Level capping that you end up reaching without difficulty. Forces you to pay membership if you wish to get past the level cap.As you can see, the cons end up out-weighing the pros. Play it if you wish. But keep in mind that if you don't want to pay for a membership, your time playing this game will be short lived.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 29, 2016
												This is a surprisingly good non-combat MMO. There is an in-depth housing system, public quests, group instances, collectible item sets, a full fishing system (complete with displayable fish), lots of minigames, and you can interact/play with a lot of the world and scenery. The Devs streamlined some features that other MMOs have to make it kid-friendly and have avoided a lot of problems that plague the genre. If you get a subscription the game gives a monthly gold allowance for the "real money" shop and the subscription price is peanuts (2.50 USD a month for a year or 3.99 USD for a single month) compared to other games that charge 14.99 USD. The Free-to-Play is more of a trial since you can't go past level 10.I really didn't expect to be writing such a positive review for this game, but there it is. It's really fun!

												Pros: has amazing graphics and animationsruns great on my toasterhas a tutorialhas a variety of different questsWell designed player housing systemCons:no mircrophone support.no zombies.needs a doge character.      This games name Amazing World is an understatement. It is the Best designed world i have ever seen in any mmorpg. The questing system is very solid and has so much variety. One minute you will be digging dirt, the next you will be jumping from bouncy bads a getting those nasty things. Its amazing how they managed to give so much variety to the gameplay despite the fact that all the classes are identical. I really liked how i could place my own stuff at my house because... i like stuff. I find some players but they were in a dog only club. so i guess i cant be friend with them. The world is very large and open. there is also lots of stuff to do. i found this game boring 10/10

content:
Posted: January 30, 2015
												As a mom, I'm always looking for games that my daughter can play. This review is a mix of her opinion and mine.Graphics.Daughter - Pretty colors! I like being the pink elephant! Me - Very bright and fun graphics. No adjustable settings so quality is lacking.Gramplay.Daughter - "Mom, why are people standing on top of each other?" "Why is there nothing here?" "I don't like this game, can I play Minecraft instead?" Me - This is where the game quickly falls off. A lot of AFK'ers. I can assume that people with slower computers might actually start experiancing lag in certain areas. (Think Stormwind mailbox in WoW pre-BC). Huge areas have NOTHING. Just plain, open areas. Not even trees or flowers. Just green space. Sometimes you see water. Sometimes you see a random NPC. Either way, it's pretty dull and lackluster.I think they should have more mini games and maybe a few more educational elements?I see a lot of potinal in this title...but as of now, you don't have my daughters attention. Once again - very cute title, just need some TLC.

												this is a game that sort of seems out of place on steam but also glad its on here. Was looking for a game to replace viacom's petpet park when it closed last year and so far, seems to win on that front.  Not going to tax most systems or need anything special for a video card which is nice. On the negative it does need a membership to fully unlock it, but its rather inexpensive really if your into these sort of games, 3.99 a month or 30 dollars for a whole year and theirs not a whole lot of customizing your zings with their apparances, but you sure get a lot of spaces for multiple ones. In general if folks do have chat enabled in this game, its friendly and generally helpful to what your doing. but keep in mind parents must enable the chat function so its rare to see kids using this.
